Q: What is the name of Ishmael’s close companion aboard the Pequod?
A:
Queequeg.

Sources: chunk_nr 929 (Moby Dick; Or, The Whale), chunk_nr 662 (Moby Dick; Or, The Whale), chunk_nr 575 (Moby Dick; Or, The Whale), chunk_nr 660 (Moby Dick; Or, The Whale).

“Captain Peleg,” said I, “I have a friend with me who wants to ship
too—shall I bring him down to-morrow?”
“To be sure,” said Peleg. “Fetch him along, and we’ll look at him.”

Metrics.R: The score is 0.22 because, although the retrieval contains clear, directly relevant lines — e.g. 'First of all was Queequeg, whom Starbuck, the chief mate, had selected' and 'the context mentions Queequeg' — most retrieved fragments are irrelevant to naming Ishmael’s companion (e.g. 'Starbuck, the chief mate' which 'does not provide the name of Ishmael's close companion', 'I have a friend with me who wants to ship too—shall I bring him down to-morrow?' which 'mentions a friend but does not give the friend's name', and many incomplete/action-focused excerpts like 'after signing the papers, off I went; nothing doubting...' that do not identify the companion).
